definition[0]: if a feeling, pain, sound etc subsides, it gradually becomes less and then stops
example[0]: Simon waited until the laughter subsided.
example[1]: The pains in his head had subsided, but he still felt dizzy and sick.
definition[1]: if a building or an area of land subsides, it gradually sinks to a lower level
example[2]: After the heavy rains, part of the road subsided.
definition[2]: if bad weather conditions subside, they gradually return to a normal state
example[3]: The wind gradually subsided, and all was quiet.
definition[3]: if water, especially flood water, subsides, it gradually goes underground or back to a normal level
example[4]: When the floods subsided, the streets were littered with bodies.
